sen.j: 忍熊皇子（おしくまのみこ、？ - 神功皇后元年（201年）3月 (旧暦)）は、『古事記』『日本書紀』に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma [(忍熊皇子), Oshikuma no Miko; his date of birth was unknown, the date of his death was in March of '201.'] first appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.

Imperial Prince Oshikuma (Oshikuma no Miko; his date of birth was unknown, the date of his death was in March of 201.) first appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.

Imperial Prince Oshikuma (Oshikuma no Miko; his date of birth was unknown, the date of his death was in March of 201.) first appeared in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) as an Imperial family (royal family) during the Kofun period (tumulus period) in Japan.

sen.j: 忍熊王、忍熊別皇子とも。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma (忍熊皇子) was written in different ways, such as "忍熊王" and "忍熊別皇子."
Imperial Prince Oshikuma (忍熊皇子) was written in different ways, such as 忍熊王 and 忍熊別皇子.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオートを削除しました。（忍熊皇子）も２回目なので削除しました。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma (忍熊皇子) was written in different ways, such as 忍熊王 and 忍熊別皇子.

sen.j: 仲哀天皇の皇子で、母は彦人大兄の女・大中姫（おおなかつひめ、大中比売命）。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma was a Prince of the Emperor Chuai, and his mother was Onakatsuhime [(大中姫); also known as 'Onakatsuhime no Mikoto' (大中比売命)] who was a daughter of Prince Hikohito no Oe (彦人大兄).
Imperial Prince Oshikuma was a Prince of the Emperor Chuai, and his mother was Onakatsuhime (also known as Onakatsuhime no Mikoto) who was a daughter of Prince Hikohito no Oe.
Imperial Prince Oshikuma was a Prince of the Emperor Chuai, and his mother was Onakatsuhime (also known as Onakatsuhime no Mikoto) who was a daughter of Prince Hikohito no Oe.
Imperial Prince Oshikuma, who was the prince of the Emperor Chuai, shared the same biological mother with Imperial Prince Kagosaka (the elder brother).
Imperial Prince Oshikuma was a young maternal half-brother of Imperial Prince Kagosaka.
Imperial Prince Oshikuma was a young maternal half-brother of Imperial Prince Kagosaka.

sen.j: 『古事記』『日本書紀』によれば、新羅征討中に仲哀天皇が崩御し、神功皇后が筑紫国で応神天皇（ほむたわけのみこと、後の応神天皇）を出産した。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihonshoki," the Emperor Chuai met with his demise during the Shiragi seito [the Conquest of Silla (ancient Korean Kingdom)], and then Empress Jingu gave birth to 'Homutawake no Mikoto (later, he became the Emperor Ojin).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihonshoki," the Emperor Chuai met with his demise during the Shiragi seito (the Conquest of Silla [ancient Korean Kingdom]), and then Empress Jingu gave birth to Homutawake no Mikoto (later, he became the Emperor Ojin.)
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更、シングルクオートの削除、ピリオドを()内に入れました。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki" and the "Nihonshoki," the Emperor Chuai met with his demise during the Shiragi seito (the Conquest of Silla [ancient Korean Kingdom]), and then Empress Jingu gave birth to Homutawake no Mikoto (later, he became the Emperor Ojin.)

sen.j: との報に接した忍熊皇子は、次の皇位が幼い皇子に決まることを恐れ、兄の坂皇子と共謀して、筑紫国から凱旋する皇后軍を迎撃しようとした。
sen.e: Upon Imperial Prince Oshikuma's hearing the news of the death of the Emperor Chuai and birth of his baby prince (the Emperor Ojin), he was afraid; since the child prince would ascend to throne and become the next Emperor; so he conspired with elder brother, Imperial Prince Kagosaka, to attack the Empress Jingu during their triumphant return trip from the Tsukushi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since Imperial Prince Oshikuma was afraid the child prince would ascend to the throne as the next Emperor when he knew the death of the Emperor Chuai and the birth of his baby prince (the Emperor Ojin), he conspired with Imperial Prince Kogasaka, his older brother, to attack the Empress army during their retuning trip from Tsukushi Province.

Since Imperial Prince Oshikuma was afraid the child prince would ascend to the throne as the next Emperor when he knew the death of the Emperor Chuai and the birth of his baby prince (the Emperor Ojin), he conspired with Imperial Prince Kogasaka, his older brother, to attack the Empress army during their retuning trip from Tsukushi Province.

sen.j: 皇子は仲哀天皇の天皇陵造営のためと偽って、播磨国赤石（明石市）に陣地を構築し、倉見別（犬上氏の祖）・五十狭茅宿禰（いさちのすくね、伊佐比宿禰とも）を将軍として東国兵を興させた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma lied about building a tomb for the Emperor Chuai in Akashi, Harima Province (Akashi City); instead, Prince Oshikuma constructed a fortified strong point; he ordered Kuramiwake (ancestor of 'Inukami no kimi') and 'Isachi no Sukune'[(五十狭茅宿禰); also written in "伊佐比宿禰") as shoguns (general), to raise a Togoku (eastern country, or eastern provinces, or Kanto provinces) regional army.

On the pretext of building the Emperor's (Chuai) tomb, Imperial Prince Oshikuma created positions in Akashi, Harima Province (Akashi City), and ordered Kuramiwake (an ancestor of Inukami no kimi) and Isachi no Sukune (an ancestor of Inukami no kimi) to raise the armies of Togoku (eastern country, or eastern provinces, or Kanto provinces) as shoguns (general).

On the pretext of building the Emperor's (Chuai) tomb, Imperial Prince Oshikuma created positions in Akashi, Harima Province (Akashi City), and ordered Kuramiwake (an ancestor of Inukami no kimi) and Isachi no Sukune (an ancestor of Inukami no kimi) to raise the armies of Togoku (eastern country, or eastern provinces, or Kanto provinces) as shoguns (general).

sen.j: ところが、菟餓野（とがの、兵庫県神戸市灘区の都賀川流域か）で反乱の成否を占う狩を行った際、坂皇子がイノシシに襲われて薨去した。
sen.e: However, when Imperial Prince Kagosaka went on a hunt that could foretell of his success or failure in the rebellion at Togano (The location is possibly the current location: Toga river basin in Nada Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture), he was attacked by a wild boar and met with his demise.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Kagosaka met with his demise by the attack of a wild boar during hunting for predicting his success in the rebellion at Togano (this location is possibly the present Toga river basin in Nada Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture).

However, Imperial Prince Kagosaka met with his demise by the attack of a wild boar during hunting for predicting his success in the rebellion at Togano (this location is possibly the present Toga river basin in Nada Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture).

sen.j: 不吉な前兆に恐れをなした忍熊王は住吉津に後退した。
sen.e: Because of this omen, Imperial Prince Oshikuma was frightened and retreated to the Suminoetsu Port.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Because of this omen, Imperial Prince Oshikuma was frightened and retreated to the Suminoetsu Port.
Because of this omen, Imperial Prince Oshikuma was frightened and retreated to the Suminoetsu Port.

sen.j: 一方の神功皇后は海路（瀬戸内海）の要所に天照大神・住吉大神を鎮祭した。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Empress Jingu took a sea route (Seto Inland Sea) and performed the Chinsai [religious ceremony (to appease the gods)] ceremony; for Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) and Sumiyoshi Okami (the great gods of Sumiyoshi) at important points along (locations) the sea route.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, the Empress Jingu performed the Chinsai (religious ceremony to appease the gods) for Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) and Sumiyoshi Okami (the great gods of Sumiyoshi) at important points along the sea route (Seto Inland Sea).
sen.cmt: 一部構文を変えました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Empress Jingu performed the Chinsai (religious ceremony to appease the gods) for Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) and Sumiyoshi Okami (the great gods of Sumiyoshi) at important points along the sea route (Seto Inland Sea).

sen.j: そして、紀伊国に上陸した。
sen.e: She finally landed on the Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She finally landed on the Kii Province.
She finally landed on the Kii Province.

sen.j: 皇子軍は更に退いて宇治市（うじ）に陣立てし、武内宿禰と武振熊（和珥氏の祖）を将軍とする皇后軍に挑んだ。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma ordered his army into retreat; then established his battle array in Uji City, and prepared for engage the army of the Empress, whose shoguns were 'Takenouchi no Sukune' and Takefuru Kuma (ancestoer of Wani Uj).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Imperial Prince Oshikuma ordered his army into retreat; then established his battle array in Uji City, and prepared for engage the army of the Empress, whose shoguns were 'Takenouchi no Sukune' and Takefuru Kuma (ancestoer of Wani Uj).

Imperial Prince Oshikuma ordered his army into retreat; then established his battle array in Uji City, and prepared for engage the army of the Empress, whose shoguns were 'Takenouchi no Sukune' and Takefuru Kuma (ancestoer of Wani Uj).

sen.j: が、武内宿禰の策略によって弓・刀を失い、逃走した果て逢坂にて敗れた（『書紀』。
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Oshikuma lost his bow and sword through the tactics of 'Takenouchi no Sukune,' then ran away, and was finally defeated at Osaka. (In the "Shoki "(Chronicles).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Oshikuma lost his bow and sword through the tactics of Takenouchi no Sukune, then ran away, and was finally defeated at Osaka. (In the "Shoki "(Chronicles).
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除しました。
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Oshikuma lost his bow and sword through the tactics of Takenouchi no Sukune, then ran away, and was finally defeated at Osaka. (In the "Shoki"(Chronicles).

sen.j: 『古事記』のこの戦闘場面に武内宿禰は登場せず、全て武振熊の功績とする）。
sen.e: [In the "Kojiki," there was no listing of the name 'Takenouchi no Sukune,' from the battle scene; all the achievements were credited to Takefuru Kuma.]
(In the "Kojiki," there was no description about Takenouchi no Sukune in the scene of the battle and all the achievements were credited to Takefuru Kuma.)
sen.cmt: ()と[]を変更と語彙の変更をしました。
sen.e: (In the "Kojiki," there was no description about Takenouchi no Sukune in the scene of the battle and all the achievements were credited to Takefuru Kuma.)

sen.j: 逃げ場を失った皇子は、五十狭茅宿禰とともに淀川に投身した。
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Oshikuma had lost his escape route, he jumped into the Yodo River along with 'Isachi no Sukune.'
After Imperial Prince Oshikuma had lost his escape route, he jumped into Yodo-gawa River along with Isachi no Sukune.
sen.cmt: シングルクオートを削除し、定訳を参照し、theの削除をして the Yodo River→ Yodo-gawa Riverに変更しました。
sen.e: After Imperial Prince Oshikuma had lost his escape route, he jumped into Yodo-gawa River along with Isachi no Sukune.

sen.j: その遺体は数日後に淀川から発見されたという。
sen.e: Then, in an anecdotal story, their dead bodies were pulled from the Yodo River a few days later.
Then, in an anecdotal story, their dead bodies were pulled from the Yodo River a few days later.
Then, in an anecdotal story, their dead bodies were pulled from the Yodo River a few days later.

sen.j: 仲哀天皇・神功皇后の実在性が疑われる中で、皇子もその例外ではない。
sen.e: Historians and other scholars are suspicious to the existence of the Emperor Chuai and the Empress Jingu; the existence of the Imperial Prince Oshikuma, is not the exception to similar suspicion.
The existence of the Emperor Chuai and the Empress Jingu is doubtful, and so with the existence of the Imperial Prince Oshikuma.
sen.cmt: 研究者は直接書かれていないので、出さない様に変更しました。
sen.e: The existence of the Emperor Chuai and the Empress Jingu is doubtful, and so with the existence of the Imperial Prince Oshikuma.

sen.j: この反乱は、後の草壁皇子・大津皇子の対立をベースとして応神天皇即位の正当性を示すために創作されたとする説もある。
sen.e: Some historians and other scholars theorized that this rebellion was created in order to legitimize the enthronement of the Emperor Ojin; this was to be based upon the dispute between Prince Kusakabe and Prince Otsu.
There is a view that this rebellion was created in order to legitimize the enthronement of the Emperor Ojin based upon the dispute between Prince Kusakabe and Prince Otsu.
sen.cmt: 研究者は直接書かれていないので、そのように変更しました。
sen.e: There is a view that this rebellion was created in order to legitimize the enthronement of the Emperor Ojin based upon the dispute between Prince Kusakabe and Prince Otsu.
